author: Anonymous Atom
title: @template tag when abstract functions are used in locals
question:
If I design a function where one of its local definitions uses an abstract function while its main body does not, do I include the use-abstract-fn template tag? For example, here's my solution for sel-sort genrec question (p5 from the accidentally released mt2):
(define (sel-sort lon)
  (if (<= (length lon) 1)
      lon
      (local [(define (c1 n rnr)
                (cond [(zero? rnr) n]
                      [(> n rnr) rnr]
                      [else n]))
              (define smallest-n (foldr c1 0 lon))]
        (cons smallest-n (sel-sort (remove smallest-n lon))))))
Would I only write (@template genrec) or would I also include use-abstract-fn?
